choices.A: Policy ID 1 is configured from the interface any to port6. FortiManager rejects the request to import this policy because the any interface does not exist on FortiManager.
choices.C: Policy ID 1 has an address object that already exists in the ADOM database with any as the interface association, and conflicts with the address object interface association locally on FortiGate.
choices.B: Policy ID 1 for this managed FortiGate already exists on FortiManager in the policy package named Remote-FortiGate.
choices.D: Policy ID 1 does not have the ADOM interface mapping configured on FortiManager.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct
C is true

questions.question_text: What must you consider before deciding to use FortiManager to manage a FortiAnalyzer device?

choices.B: Ensure that FortiAnalyzer features are installed in advance.
choices.C: Check whether FortiManager is part of a high availability (HA) cluster.
choices.A: Confirm that FortiManager has enough storage capacity for the expected logs.
choices.D: Determine whether the VDOMs of the same FortiGate will be assigned to different ADOMs.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct. When FMG is managing a FAZ, you cannot switch to advanced mode. And it s only in advanced mode Vdoms of the same Fortigate can be assigned to differents ADOM

Selected Answer: C
FortiManager in HA may require additional configuration steps or have certain limitations when managing other devices, including a FortiAnalyzer.
The other options are not determining factors for FortiManager to "take control" of a FortiAnalyzer's configuration.

Selected Answer: C
D is unquestionably correct. 
However, C seems correct too, anyone? Please check FMG 7.4 guide p11. It says: If Faz features are enabled, YOu cannot add faz to fmg, you will also not be able to configure FMG HA. Somebody, enlighten me please.

comments.content: Im good now. no body helped me with my confusion so I did my own reading. D is 1000% right.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
The correct answer is D: Determine whether the VDOMs of the same FortiGate will be assigned to different ADOMs.
This is important because:

When using FortiManager to manage FortiAnalyzer, you must ensure proper ADOM (Administrative Domain) configuration, particularly when dealing with FortiGate VDOMs (Virtual Domains).
All VDOMs from the same FortiGate device must be assigned to the same ADOM in FortiAnalyzer. This is a strict requirement that cannot be circumvented.

Selected Answer: C
Correct answer: C. Check whether FortiManager is part of a high availability (HA) cluster.
Correct. Enabling FortiAnalyzer features is not possible if FortiManager is already in HA mode. HA must be disabled before enabling FortiAnalyzer features.
Reference: FortiManager Administration Guide, p. 38.

Explanation:
A. Incorrect. Logs are stored on FortiAnalyzer, not FortiManager, so storage capacity on FortiManager is not relevant.
Reference: FortiManager Administration Guide, p. 123.

B. Incorrect. FortiAnalyzer features must be enabled on FortiManager, but the critical point is that this cannot be done if FortiManager is already part of an HA cluster.
Reference: FortiManager Administration Guide, p. 38.

D. Incorrect. This applies to FortiGate devices managed in FortiManager and does not directly concern FortiAnalyzer management.
Reference: FortiManager Administration Guide, p. 113.

comments.content:
D is completely relevant, PAY ATTENTION. 

if different VDOMs of the same Fortigate will be managed in different ADOM, FMG should be configure in advanced mode. But if you manage a Fortianalyzer, you cannot configure FMG in Advanced Mode.

discussion.content:
I don't found any correct response.

A Wrong because the logs kept on the FAZ
B Wrong because if FMG manage FAZ is not need enable FAZ feature
C should be wrong because i don't find anything about it
D wrong because it's not relevant about question
Any suggestions?

choices.B: To save the current state of all policy packages and objects for an ADOM
choices.C: To revert individual policy packages and device-level settings for a managed FortiGate
choices.A: To save the current state of the whole ADOM
choices.D: To save the FortiManager configuration in the System Checkpoints

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Guide Pg 193:
“Note that an ADOM revision is a snapshot of the entire ADOM and not the changes specific to this policy package.”
Pag 199:
“This also includes policy packages, objects, and VPN console settings.”
So B its only partial true. A is more accurate.

Selected Answer: B
page 199 in the Study Guide.
answer B

Selected Answer: B
ADOM revisions takes a snapshot of Policy & Objects database for that ADOM => answer B

Selected Answer: A
It's A, as detailed on page 193 is the study Guide - "Note that an ADOM revision is a snaphsot of the entire ADOM and not the changes specific to this policy package." This also includes Policies Packages, objects and VPN console settings as stated on page 199 in the Study Guide.

Selected Answer: A
B only mentions policy packages and objects. VPN Console Settings are also included in revisions. Therefore answer should be A

Selected Answer: B
A is false because Revision does not permit to save the whole ADOM
C is false because ADOM Revision is related to all policy package in the ADOM, and does not concern device settings
D is false because ADOM Revision does not concern the save of all Fortimanager

Answer B

Selected Answer: B
B

questions.question_text:
Refer to the exhibit.
//IMG//

An administrator is about to add the FortiGate device to FortiManager using the discovery process.
FortiManager is operating behind a NAT device, and the administrator configured the FortiManager NATed IP address under the FortiManager system administration settings.
What is the expected result?

choices.C: During discovery, FortiManager sets the NATed device IP address on FortiGate.
choices.A: During discovery, FortiManager uses only the FortiGate serial number to establish the connection.
choices.B: During discovery, FortiManager sets both the FortiManager NATed IP address and NAT device IP address on FortiGate.
choices.D: During discovery, FortiManager sets the FortiManager NATed IP address on FortiGate.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Answer is A. From user Satekhi under the NSE5_FMG-7.2 topic, same question: "The command in question is execute fmprofile import-profile ADOM2 3547 /tmp/myfile. If the administrator is importing the system template profile into ADOM2, and considering each ADOM has a unique object database, the file is likely being imported from the FortiManager file system. ~ FMG 7.2 p109"

questions.question_text:
An administrator is in the process of copying a system template profile between ADOMs by running the following command: execute fmprofile import-profile ADOM2 3547 /tmp/myfile
Where does this command import the system template profile from?
